results.content: Joe teaching what he does best! Top guy and a great breadth of knowledge. The relaxed attitude and teaching examples are awesome. Many thanks - keep up the good work
results.content_html: Joe teaching what he does best! Top guy and a great breadth of knowledge. The relaxed attitude and teaching examples are awesome. Many thanks - keep up the good work

results.content: Very informative. I've learned a lot so far. Covers a lot of content. Pausing and trying the examples yourself is recommended. I like the pacing as Joe doesn't really hold your hand and waste time with a lot of unnecessary terms and examples. I'm about halfway through at the time of writing this. I'll update once I'm done.
results.content_html: Very informative. I've learned a lot so far. Covers a lot of content. Pausing and trying the examples yourself is recommended. I like the pacing as Joe doesn't really hold your hand and waste time with a lot of unnecessary terms and examples. I'm about halfway through at the time of writing this. I'll update once I'm done.

results.content: The course is very detailed and straight forward. Joe explains everything in a manner that is easy to understand and it allows you to instantly start writing your own HTML and CSS. He provides real world/industry examples of how/when/why certain things are used allowing you a peak into what you should expect in the job market. I highly recommend this course for someone completely new to HTML/CSS, or someone who simply wants/needs a quick refresher.

results.content: The course is incomplete.  He literally says in the last seconds of the last video (41) video that on the next video he'll refactor and make it get close to the mockup he's actually showing on the video promo of this course. Mind you this was 3 years sgo. The content may be worthwhile but don't sell a blatantly incomplete course.  Refund requested.
